{"step_by_step_thinking": "Astrocytes are a type of glial cell in the brain and spinal cord. They play several roles, including the provision of nutrients to the nervous tissue, maintenance of extracellular ion balance, and a role in the repair and scarring process of the brain and spinal cord following traumatic injuries. Importantly, astrocytes also contribute to the formation and maintenance of the blood-brain barrier, a protective barrier that separates the circulating blood from the brain extracellular fluid in the central nervous system.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
